page.title: 06FISHING FAMILY,ANNAN
page.content: The family which I belong to is the Willacy's.In Annan the family is well known for it's involvement with fishing.Five generations have been involved. My dad built a boat, called the IVY WILLACY,when he was 15.It was named after my gran. The family,at one time,kept boats and fished from Annan harbour.Today the new boat,STAR OF ANNAN,is kept at Kirkcudbright. My dad used to fish for shrimps but now he fishes for Queenies.These are small shellfish which look a bit like scallops.After catching them they are sold to a factory in Kirkcudbright. They are then unshelled and packed.They are sold to hotels and fish shops. This fishing connection may end as there is only one son to carry it on.
